availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Requisitions for the Return of Fugitives from Justice, 1863-1867

body.p:
The People of the state of Illinois
To
State of Illinois
Peoria County } ss

Whereas it has been represented to me by Matthew Skiffington that he is arre unlawfully and unjustly held in custody ^and detained^ by you the said persons now having him in custody, names unknown These are therefore in the name and by the authority of the people of the state of Illinois that you have the body of the said Matthew Skiffington forthwith before me at the Court house in the city of Peoria Illinois together with the cause of his caption & detention
Witness my hand & seal this 18th day of October 1865,

In response to the within writ I present the Body of Mathias Skiffington in Court -- held in custody by me by virtue of a requisition from the Governor of Kentucky on the Governor of JefIllinois, and the warrant of the Governor of Illinois copies of which are hereto attached

Wm Hipwell
agent of the State of Kentucky

By the Habeas corpus act
M Williamson
Judge
